### PR summary [25503abe0a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22695/commits/25503abe0a6852aeca726aed38ffc5be54bc6aa7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.Set.FunctorToTypes` (new file)|378|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Set` (new file)|601|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ functorToTypes`
`+ instance {J : Type w} [Category.{w'} J] {X : Type u} [IsFilteredOrEmpty J] :`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#22694~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13738244124/job/38424483630)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13738244124/job/38424483709)

I think the name `Set.toTypes` is too generic for the "global" `Set` namespace; it should be clear that this is a category theory thing, possibly containing "functor" somewhere in the name.

Also, it would be good if we could find a more discoverable place for this functor. Sadly, there seems to be no natural file that combines the required imports
```
import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Category.Preorder
import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Types
import Mathlib.Data.Set.Basic
```
I have moved (and renamed) the definition to a separate file `Data.Set.FunctorToTypes`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Limits): sup in `Set X` and filtered colimits in `Type`
